timeline.bodyText: Is it OK to continue in row of negative ids?
timeline.author: sgflt

timeline.bodyText: TYPE_ENUM seems to be unused, but for sure I just decreased indentifier.
timeline.author: sgflt

replies.bodyText: It could be used from our other projects like JET. Lets don't change it and add  JAVA_DEFAULT_TYPE_OPTIONAL as -51
replies.author: sancar

replies.bodyText:
I have tried suggested change, but there is a small problem with indexes. java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: Index 51 out of bounds for length 51
Each identifier is used as index to an array of registered serializers. ENUM is not registered and this causes null element on index 50 if CONSTANT_SERIALIZERS_LENGTH is set to 52.
Is the null acceptable in array of serializers? (At first glance it seems to me as some kind of access optimization that is trying to prevent null to exist in array)
replies.author: sgflt

replies.bodyText: Hi @sgflt , I have double-checked. It seems that the enum serializer is actually deleted but accidentally put back when doing a merge. We can delete it completely.
replies.author: sancar

replies.bodyText: Hi @sancar. I've pushed commit with deletion of unused constant. Thanks for review.
replies.author: sgflt
